metadata.description: Utility Arborists step in and clear vegetation from electrical equipment and structures, ensuring the continued and safe flow of power to our homes and communities.

markdown:
Skip to main content 

![Arborist cutting tree](/sites/default/files/2023-01/Arborist%20%28YOUTH%29.jpg)

As a Utility Arborist, you’ll find the balance between physical, adventurous and nimble work with the need to be extra careful. 

You’ll clear trees and plants away from electrical equipment, including power lines, whether because of natural growth or storms. Your work will require a solid grounding in the use of arborist equipment and an excellent understanding of safety regulations. 

#### What You'll Learn

  * How to identify and apply regulations 
  * How to use aerial lifts, chippers, and chainsaws 
  * How to assess, identify and prune trees 
  * How to fall and buck 
  * How to use rigging and climbing gear 



#### Key Job Skills

  * Coordination 
  * Critical thinking 
  * Equipment operation 
  * Tree and plant pruning, falling, and limbing 
  * Site inspections 



#### Technical Training

To get certified, you will need to sign up for technical training at an approved training provider in addition to on-the-job training. 

Visit [Trades Training BC](https://www.tradestrainingbc.ca/) and [EducationPlannerBC](https://educationplannerbc.ca/search) for a comprehensive list of what programs are available in your trade at public and non-public schools. 

For a list of all approved non-public training providers, [visit this page](/all-approved-training-providers-list).

**Proximity Verification Form**

[Work-Based Training Proximity Verification Declaration](/media/458/download)

Technical Training 8 weeks over 2 years 

Work-Based Training

2378 HOURS

General Skills

[Adventurous](/find-your-trade?f%5B0%5D=skills_taxonomy_term_name%3AAdventurous) [Athletic](/find-your-trade?f%5B0%5D=skills_taxonomy_term_name%3AAthletic) [Curious](/find-your-trade?f%5B0%5D=skills_taxonomy_term_name%3ACurious) [Visual](/find-your-trade?f%5B0%5D=skills_taxonomy_term_name%3AVisual)

Program Updates

None.

## 

Program Information and Resources

#### [Program Profile Occupational Description Utility Arborists undertake any work required to prune or clear vegetation in proximity to energized electrical equipment, structures and conductors. They also prune, fall or remove trees which could come into close contact (three metres or less) with energized power lines. Only certified Utility Arborists and Utility Arborist apprentices are permitted to perform tree pruning or falling work in proximity* to energized power lines in British Columbia. The Utility Arborist challenge pathway is only open to challengers who have trade-related work experience from outside of B.C.  *proximity is defined as a distance of three meters or less from a primary conductor with a voltage of 750 volts or greater.  View Program Profile](/media/2049/download)

#### [Program Outline Guidelines for delivery of technical training at SkilledTradesBC Recognized Training Providers View PDF](/media/388/download) #### [Record Book An easy-to-use tool to help you identify your trades training needs, track your progress, and move towards certification. View PDF](/media/336/download)

## 

Challenge the Trade

If you have significant work experience in a trade but have never been certified in Canada, you may apply to challenge the certification. Learn more about [How to Challenge a Skilled Trade](/challenge-skilled-trade).

#### [Instructions How to Apply View](https://skilledtradesbc.ca/instructions-challenge-certification) #### [Online Application Sign up for the Portal to start your online application Start Application](https://portal.skilledtradesbc.ca/Account/Login/Register?registrationType=certified) #### [Employer Declaration Document of relevant work experience View PDF](/media/927/download) #### [Statutory Declaration Attestation for self-employment/work experience when employer cannot be contacted View PDF](/media/928/download)
